info.author: Glen Mailer
info.description:
git mnemonic
============

Speakable, rememberable translations for git ref hashes

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/glenjamin/git-mnemonic.png)](https://travis-ci.org/glenjamin/git-mnemonic)

Usage
-----

From inside a git repository

    # Defaults to HEAD
    $ git mnemonic
    end line grab ding

    # Can be given a specific revision
    $ git mnemonic origin/master
    line pot end bear

    # Will translate back to the full git hash
    $ git mnemonic line pot end bear
    4b63bf41e0c2369c76b6e3ce3ea40ed5fa0977c3

Install
-------

    pip install git-mnemonic

TODO
----

It'd be really nice to produce a really friendly word list, that contained only
words that sounded audiably distinct and were easy to spell / type / read.
It would also be awesome to support multiple spellings of tricky words.
info.name: git-mnemonic
info.html_description:
Speakable, rememberable translations for git ref hashes

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/glenjamin/git-mnemonic.png)](https://travis-ci.org/glenjamin/git-mnemonic)

Usage

From inside a git repository

# Defaults to HEAD $ git mnemonic end line grab ding

# Can be given a specific revision $ git mnemonic origin/master line pot end bear

# Will translate back to the full git hash $ git mnemonic line pot end bear 4b63bf41e0c2369c76b6e3ce3ea40ed5fa0977c3

Install

pip install git-mnemonic

TODO

It’d be really nice to produce a really friendly word list, that contained only words that sounded audiably distinct and were easy to spell / type / read. It would also be awesome to support multiple spellings of tricky words.
